title: Authorizes reimbursement for Tay-Sachs testing
summary: Provides that every policy which provides coverage for hospital, surgical or medical care or provides reimbursement for laboratory tests or diagnostic X-rays shall provide coverage for Tay-Sachs testing; provides that in order to maintain the confidentiality of persons tested, receipt of acknowledgement from the testing facility shall be deemed sufficient evidence of testing.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2311

TITLE OF BILL:

An act
to amend the insurance law, in relation to reimbursement for
Tay-Sachs testing

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:

Amends subsection (i) of section 3216, subsection (1) of section 3221
and section 4303 of the insurance law to authorize reimbursement for
Tay-Sachs testing.

The bill also states that in order to maintain the confidentiality of
persons tested, receipt of acknowledgement from the testing facility
shall be deemed sufficient evidence of testing.

JUSTIFICATION:

Tay-Sachs is a genetic disease which causes degeneration of the
nervous system and results in death. No treatment is currently
available for the disease, however, an infant can only be inflicted
with the disease if both the mother and father are carriers. There is
currently a testing system in place which screens individuals before
marriage to determine if they are carriers. These individuals should
be able to receive reimbursement for this medical screening through
their insurance carrier.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:

None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:

Immediately.
